required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Immunological Profile for Patients Treated With CAR-T Cells
clinical_study.official_title: Immunological Profile for Patients Treated With CAR-T Cells

brief_summary.textblock:
In the frame of Si-CART study, blood will be collected from patients treated with CAR-T cells: before (at Day (D)-6 and D0 before cells injection), post infusion at D3, D5,D7, D9, D11, D14, D18, D 21, Month (M) 2 and M12 post injection.
A cerebrospinal fluid sample will also be collected if a Cerebrospinal Fluid Analysis Lumbar puncture is performed

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation between serum markers and adverse events at 1 year of the CAR-T cells infusion
primary_outcome.description: Serum concentration of cytokines in relation to adverse events

secondary_outcome.measure: CAR-T cells rate from infusion to one year after CAR-T cells infusion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From CAR-T cells infusion to one year

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with a relapse
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From CAR-T cells infusion to one year
secondary_outcome.description: Relapse rate from CAR-T cells infusion to one year

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with a cytokine release syndrome
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From CAR-T cells infusion to one year
secondary_outcome.description: Cytokine release syndrome from CAR-T cells infusion to one year

intervention.description: Blood samples collection: at Day (D)-6 and D0 before CAR-T cells injection, post injection at Day (D)3, D5,D7, D9, D11, D14, D18, D 21, Month 2 and Month 12 post injection.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age ≥ 18 years
- Planned injection of CAR-T cells within the scope of marketing authorization
- Signed informed consent
- French social security affiliation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women, or women of childbearing potential (without medically acceptable contraception) or breastfeeding women.
- Patient in emergency situation, adult under legal protection (patient placed under tutorship, curatorship, or judicial protection) or unable to give his consent
- Impossibility to comply with trial medical follow-up for geographic, social or psychological reasons
